quizzes.question: What is DOM?
quizzes.textContent:
[h1]The DOM[/h1]

When you open any webpage in a browser, the HTML of the page is loaded and rendered visually on the screen.
To accomplish that, the browser builds the [b]Document Object Model[/b] of that page, which is an object oriented model of its logical structure.
The DOM of an HTML document can be represented as a nested set of boxes: [img id="2773" width="100%"]
[note]JavaScript can be used to manipulate the DOM of a page dynamically to add, delete and modify elements.[/note]

[h1]The document Object[/h1]

There is a predefined [b]document [/b]object in JavaScript, which can be used to access all elements on the DOM.
In other words, the [b]document [/b]object is the owner (or [b]root[/b]) of all objects in your webpage.
So, if you want to access objects in an HTML page, you always start with accessing the document object.
[b]For example: [/b][code format="js" ]document.body.[b]innerHTML [/b]= "Some text";[/code]
As [b]body [/b]is an element of the DOM, we can access it using the [b]document [/b]object and change the content of the [b]innerHTML [/b]property.
[note]The [b]innerHTML [/b]property can be used on almost all HTML elements to change its content.[/note]
